html.p: Proposition. If [mathjaxinline]S: \mathbb R^ p \rightarrow \mathbb R^ n[/mathjaxinline] and [mathjaxinline]T: \mathbb R^ n \rightarrow \mathbb R^ m[/mathjaxinline] are linear transformations, then [mathjaxinline]T\circ S: \mathbb R^ p \rightarrow \mathbb R^ m[/mathjaxinline] is a linear transformation.

Fundamental Fact of Matrix Multiplication. If the [mathjaxinline]m\times n[/mathjaxinline] matrix [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] is the standard matrix for [mathjaxinline]T: \mathbb R^ n \rightarrow \mathbb R^ m[/mathjaxinline], and the [mathjaxinline]n\times p[/mathjaxinline] matrix [mathjaxinline]B[/mathjaxinline] is the standard matrix for [mathjaxinline]S: \mathbb R^ p \rightarrow \mathbb R^ n[/mathjaxinline], then [mathjaxinline]AB[/mathjaxinline] will be an [mathjaxinline]m\times p[/mathjaxinline] matrix which is the standard matrix for [mathjaxinline]T\circ S: \mathbb R^ p \rightarrow \mathbb R^ m[/mathjaxinline].

(If the number of columns of [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] is not equal to the number of rows of [mathjaxinline]B[/mathjaxinline], then [mathjaxinline]AB[/mathjaxinline] is not defined, just as the composition [mathjaxinline]T\circ S[/mathjaxinline] would not be defined.)
